titles.title: Leadership PAC Prohibition Act of 2006
To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit the establishment of leadership political action committees, and for other purposes.
Leadership PAC Prohibition Act of 2006

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary:
Leadership PAC Prohibition Act of 2006 - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit a candidate for federal office or federal officeholder from directly or indirectly establishing, financing, maintaining, or controlling any federal or non-federal political committee other than a principal campaign committee of the candidate, an authorized committee, a committee of a political party, or other designated political committee.
Allows a candidate for more than one federal office to designate a separate principal campaign committee for each federal office.
